Class NavigationHistory

java.lang.Object
  NavigationHistory

public class NavigationHistory
extends java.lang.Object

Created by IntelliJ IDEA. User: Owner Date: 3/15/11 Time: 4:24 AM To change this template use File | Settings | File Templates. Attempts to implement an (internet) browser style navigation history for the sequence of zooms that led to the current image. Requirement 1.1.10 Ability to "step back" using a navigation history Requirement 1.1.11 Ability to undo a step back todo: deactivate irrelevant options in menubar

Constructor Summary
NavigationHistory(ImageSize logicalImageSize, ImageSize displayedImageSize, java.io.File fileToOpen)
          If starting in webstart mode, the param fileToOpen should indicate the file to display on startup; if not, fileToOpen should be null, start at home screen (as specified by MandelCanvasFactory).

public NavigationHistory(ImageSize logicalImageSize,
                         ImageSize displayedImageSize,
                         java.io.File fileToOpen)
If starting in webstart mode, the param fileToOpen should indicate the file to display on startup; if not, fileToOpen should be null, start at home screen (as specified by MandelCanvasFactory).

associateThumbnail

public void associateThumbnail(LocationThumbnail thumbnail)
Need a ref to thumbnail so it can be told to update when the selected image changes. todo: move this feature into the gui, doesn't belong here

Parameters:
thumbnail -

getCurrent

public MandelCanvas getCurrent()
Returns:
the MandelCanvas currently selected, i.e. b/w the previous and back stacks.

zoom

public void zoom(ImageRegion screenSelection)
User has selected a new MandelCanvas via zooming (rather than using a navigation history feature like 'back'). History should treat this situation analogous to clicking a new link in a browser.

Parameters:
screenSelection -

back

public void back()
If possible, retrieve the last selected image and update all navigation data accordingly.

home

public void home()
Return to home screen. Clears 'next' b/c most browsers do this, when selecting home (in theory 'next' recovers pages that were left when using 'back', since the user did not use back for the most recent navigation, 'next' makes less sense). Interestingly, on chrome if you use 'home' and then 'back,' the 'next' list is restored. todo: consider whether this is a good idea

forward

public void forward()

setCurrent

public void setCurrent(MandelCanvas canvas)
Mostly a helper method for other navigation functions; not private because opening a save file will require access to this feature.

Parameters:
canvas -
